text: We time for a GME update because we have some big news on what's going on today, the 11th of June that I want to walk you guys through now again to be clear. I am an option trader. That is my perspective on this stuff. It's how I got alerted to the most recent price movement because I noticed unusual transaction volume. Obviously it was roaring kitty didn't know that at the time. So I started placing trades based on that. I'm familiar with GameStop, but I am nowhere near as read in as you guys are the ape community. I consider myself a guest in the house as it is right now. I traded the last squeeze, but there's people that have been here over that entire duration really, really involved. So I am having a blast learning about this entire thing. What you guys are working on. Now from a trading perspective, I want to walk us through some position updates and the way I think this thing could go into the expiration next Friday because that's really where all the interesting stuff is set to happen. Now the very first thing we have to talk about is not this tweet, although I think it's funny because we even have somebody like Timothy Sykes now trying to badmouth roaring kitty. I just can't help but find it funny that everybody is trying to say something negative about this guy that roaring kitty is a shell that he's

And he's getting really close to one of the most interesting ones in my opinion, which would be a cashless exercise. What that means is if the total gain on his position is large enough to cover the total cost, so if the total gain is over 240 million dollars, he can exercise his options and use the gain to cover the entire position. He was very close to that. If not over it, if I'm not mistaken. So he obviously has no problem waiting and allowing the position to play out. He still does have 29.4 million dollars to back him up though. So he's not quite there yet for some sort of cash transaction, but he's not super far off either because his shares will accumulate that he could always offload if he needed the cash, but he won't need to probably because he can always take it on margin where he doesn't have to put up the full 240 million dollars. They'll see it in a heartbeat and they will happily fade into it to follow that down move. The floor would come out if he started trying to unwind this in a big way. So do I think that's what's going to happen here? Probably not. It doesn't seem so much like his M.O. Because then if he does that exercise, the market makers have to go find a bunch of shares on the open market that's already pretty limited because you guys are super smart, DRS in your shares, which is going to bid things up even more because it is a low, low volume pool that they can pull from that they're all trying to pull from. So that looks like the primary play here. He could always exercise part of his position, sell part of his position. There's no rules, meaning he can do whatever he wants with each and every one of those single contracts. What I can say is that I highly doubt he would do anything all at once. I don't think there's a reality where he hits the button to sell 120,000 contracts. He would get murdered on the spread and the market makers would have a field day with that. He would probably have to phase out in 10,000 lot. And even that would be picked up super fast. You get two or three of those out and it would be seen nearly immediately. So one of the coolest things you
